moves.details: Initialize Go modules (if needed). Choose a web framework (e.g., Gin or Echo). Set up basic project structure (e.g., cmd/, internal/, pkg/) and a minimal HTTP server.
Extract configuration loading (from config.json/env/defaults) from main CLI logic into a reusable package/struct.
Create backend API endpoints (e.g., GET /api/config, POST /api/config) to fetch and update configuration using the refactored logic.
Initialize a new Vite project with React 19 and TypeScript. Install and configure Tailwind CSS 4 and shadcn/ui.
Implement the main application layout structure (e.g., header, main content area) using shadcn/ui components.
Create React components for displaying and editing configuration settings (credentials, formats, paths, FFmpeg options).
Integrate the frontend configuration UI with the backend GET/POST /api/config endpoints.
Isolate the core nugs.net download functionality (authentication, metadata fetching, downloading, FFmpeg handling) from CLI argument parsing into callable Go functions/methods.
Create data structures and logic in Go to manage a queue of download jobs (in-memory for now). Include job details like URL, options, status.
Create a backend API endpoint (e.g., POST /api/downloads) that accepts download request parameters and adds a new job to the queue.
Create a background worker (using goroutines) that processes jobs from the download queue sequentially, calling the refactored core download logic.
Create a basic backend API endpoint (e.g., GET /api/downloads) to retrieve the current list of download jobs and their status.
Create React components for inputting nugs.net URLs and selecting download options (formats, flags).
Integrate the frontend download input UI with the backend POST /api/downloads endpoint to add jobs to the queue.
Create React components to display the list of download jobs fetched from the GET /api/downloads endpoint.

moves.description: Enhance Download Logic for Real-time Feedback
moves.details: Modify the refactored core download logic to report progress updates (percentage, speed, status changes, logs) via channels or callbacks.
Set up a WebSocket or Server-Sent Events endpoint (e.g., /ws/status) in the Go backend to broadcast download progress updates.
Modify the backend queue worker to push progress updates received from the core download logic to connected clients via the WebSocket/SSE endpoint.
Add WebSocket/SSE client logic to the React frontend to connect to the backend and receive real-time updates.

moves.description: Enhance Frontend Queue Display for Real-time
moves.details: Update the queue display components to reflect real-time status, progress, and logs received via WebSocket/SSE.
Add logic to the backend (potentially in the core downloader or API layer) to extract or fetch album/video artwork URLs from nugs.net metadata.
Create a backend endpoint (or modify existing status endpoint) to provide artwork URLs alongside download job data.
Update the frontend queue display components to show the artwork fetched via the API.
Create backend API endpoints for managing the queue (e.g., DELETE /api/downloads/{jobId}, POST /api/downloads/reorder).
Add UI elements (buttons, drag-and-drop?) to the frontend for removing or reordering jobs in the queue, connected to the management API endpoints.
Add a 'Copy Original URL' button to completed download items in the UI.
Perform general UI cleanup, improve styling consistency, add loading states, and enhance error handling throughout the frontend.
Conduct thorough testing of all features: configuration, adding downloads, queue behavior, real-time updates, artwork, sharing, error conditions.
